summary: This document is an email chain from March 2020 between an Assistant United States Attorney from the Southern District of New York's 'SONY Epstein team' and attorney Gloria Allred. The emails discuss scheduling a call to provide an update and discuss Allred's clients, indicating coordination between federal prosecutors and a lawyer representing victims in the Epstein case.

persons.name: Gloria Allred
persons.context: Prominent attorney communicating with the U.S. Attorney's Office regarding a scheduled call to discuss her clients and receive an update from the Epstein prosecution team.

connections.description: Attorney Allred is in communication with a federal prosecutor from the SDNY Epstein team to discuss her clients and receive case updates.

events.title: Initial call between Allred and prosecutors
events.description: Gloria Allred spoke with the U.S. Attorney's Office, during which specific individuals (likely clients/victims) were mentioned for discussion.

events.title: Scheduled update call
events.description: A call was scheduled for 3:00 PM EST between Gloria Allred and the SDNY Epstein prosecution team to provide an update and discuss her clients.

keyFacts: The communication is between the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York (specifically the 'SONY Epstein team') and victims' attorney Gloria Allred.
The prosecutors sought to provide Allred with an update and discuss 'some of your clients in particular,' indicating active coordination with victims' counsel.
The emails show scheduling efforts for a call on March 31, 2020, highlighting ongoing investigative or prosecutorial activity years after Epstein's death.
The correspondence is marked as confidential and legally privileged, underscoring the sensitive nature of the discussions.
The document references a previous conversation on March 26, 2020, where specific individuals (likely victims) were discussed.
